title: Is it fair for one item to completely counter a champion?
body:
All champions can be at least slightly countered by items, but some champions are basically useless if the enemy team buys one certain item.
Some examples would be, Vlad{{champion:8}}  gets crap for healing, which is what his whole kit and theme is evolved around, if the enemy laner just gets {{item:3123}}  executioner's calling, for mages its not as bad because {{item:3165}}  only reduces healing to champions below 35% health. But for people like swain, vladimir, Aatox (R.I.P), soraka, sona, and mundo they get pretty much screwed from an 800 gold item, not as much for soraka and sona since they are healing for other people, but anyone who relies on healing themself through an ability is countered by an 800 gold item, doesn't seem to fair in my opinion. Maybe if Executioner's calling only applied grievous wounds to champion below 40% health would be more balanced, and more similar how it works for {{item:3165}}
Do you think the passive for {{item:3123}} executioner's calling is a bit to strong against some champions?

Build path, long sword + 450 gold = executioner's calling

There's a difference between countering a role, and countering a specific champion.

For instance, LW counters tanks in general, but Thresh gets gimped in particular because his armour reserves are practically all bonus.

That was a weak example because LW is otherwise "healthy and necessary", but a strong example is an item such as Zhonya's which invalidates not only AD assassins, but also most any burst champion. Hence why its stats were repeatedly nerfed until its _only_ redeeming factor was its active.

Grievous Wounds is an extreme offender because it makes a whole swath of champions - but not any particular role - worthless fairly easily and consistently. Healing is a mechanic that more than bleeds over from the healer-support role, it's practically a core mechanic of several champions such as Mundo, Vladimir, Aatrox, Zac, so on and so forth.

No, I don't think it's fair, and hard-counter mechanics like Grievous Wounds and True Sight are why some champions have such a disparity in performance across rankings, as well as wonky balance on their kits. As long as hard counters exist in League, there will be balance issues around those mechanics where the systems they counter end up being overly strong in their "natural" state, as can be seen already with some healing champions and tanks in general (they need excessive armor to make up for Last Whisper negating almost half of the amount purchased on its own). Removing those effects altogether would likely be the better option, as it would focus the counters to those mechanics around proper, interactive gameplay, rather than shop-based rock-paper-scissors.

Atm, Executioner's Calling can apply 40% healing reduction for a whole 3 seconds, just from a single auto.
This 800 G item negates a lot of the strength of champions reliant on healing.

What if instead of just getting countered by a single auto, Grievous Wounds stacked up its healing reduction.
8% healing reduction for 1.5 seconds. So it breaks even with current value after 5 autos. Subsequent autos refresh GW duration (1.5 seconds). Caps out at 64% damage reduction.
That way, it would require them to actually go out their way to actively attack you for the course of the next few seconds. Rather than just tagging you with a single auto and screwing you over.

Alternatively, keep damage reduction same at 40%, but lower its duration, so it would require the ADC to constantly focus you during a fight, which is what you want as a sustain tank.

To answer your question, that depends on how niche that item actually is. 

If I force you to counter build me, and you make trade offs to do so, I'm giving my team an Advantage because your are no longer on your optimal item path. Of coarse, those champions tend to get seen as Oppressive, if those counter items are viewed as non viable, or that they feel too obligated to actually counterbuild me. 

You mentioned Morrelo's isn't so bad because of it only applies 35% or less. Which is good, otherwise, Morrelo's is so core on mages that they would counter sustain by default. Now Executioner's calling is more interesting choice, because while it will counter Sustain for only 800 gold, it alone isn't slot efficient, and you won't have in your ending build, unless you upgrade it to mortal reminder. But then you would be choosing that over Lord Dominikan's regard. And if you have to chose between counter building a mid lane Vlad, or a top lane Maokai, I still have you in a bind.

Actually Mortal Reminder (and by extension Executioners Calling), is incredibly useful and really not a counterpick item, largely because it works against such a wide range of things.

Take ADCs for example, a lot of them often build a single life-steal item (or use that mastery that grants lifesteal), and having a mortal reminder cuts that sustain by a very large amount.  Also, the item is very useful against a very large amount of tanks/bruisers/juggernauts because a decent chunk of them all have sustain built in there kit (Maokai with his passive for example), or in the case of some bruisers that end up building lifesteal items, on top of the fact that it also grants a pretty massive amount of armor shred.

Frankly I see no reason to ever grab a Lord Dominiks Regard unless they have a very large amount of purely dedicated tanks, or if they only have a single champion that has sustain in their build/kit (AKA only the ADC has lifesteal).

I don't think {{item:3123}} is too strong, in my opinion.
I don't have stats to share but 800g spent on some minor healing effects (like pots, HP regen and whatnot) isn't worth the purchase while getting it early for the drain tanks increases the risks for them, when they engage in fights and count on that healing.
Grevious Wounds doesn't completely stop the healing, it just reduces the effectiveness of healing. It makes targets easier to kill through healing effects.

The reason why {{item:3123}}  and {{item:3165}} have the same effect, but have different duration and item cost is because of the "spell VS AA" problem. Caster champions by default spend a lot more resources using their spells and that's where their DPS comes from. AA champions basically only pay for their damage in terms of AS (and over time, in other stats).

champions should be hard countered by items if they lack other counters, yes.
